lines: It's Valentine's Day, and you have just discovered that ${spouseName} received a box of candy and a "mushy" card from his secretary, who wanted to "express her appreciation for all of the kindness and generosity he has shown..." What will you do?
#GIVE HIM THE THIRD DEGREE ABOUT HIS SECRETARY (THAT @$#%!)

You don't have to mention it. He tells you about it, himself. "How do you like that. She went through the trouble of finding out just what I like. She's such an absolute doll! I wouldn't trade her in for anything." It seems like he
would have been just as happy with a box of dried fertilizer! Are you feeling a little jealous?
That's understandable. He certainly is laying it on a bit thick. After a while, he settles down.
Later in the evening, he asks you to do him a small favor. How will you treat him?
#SAY, "WHY DON'T YOU HAVE YOUR WONDERFUL SECRETARY DO IT FOR YOU, DARLING?"
The claws are really sharp tonight, aren't they? He gets the message.
You have passed up a golden opportunity for sarcasm and hostility. You should be proud of yourself. These are the times when relationships grow the most.
You must have a very strong ego.
You want to know as many details about his secretary as possible so, if you ever see her, you can completely stomp on her. You are the jealous type.
Sometimes people are jealous when they can't be trusted themselves, you know. Judging by your status sheet, perhaps you should give this some thought!
Perhaps you find it difficult to believe that someone can be as Trustworthy as you seem to be.
That is very honest of you. At least you didn't do something that would allow your jealousy to display itself in a more hostile form.
